abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Economic Recovery Credit (ERC) in
            Senegal. The Economic Recovery Credit (ERC) was designed to
            support the reform program introduced by the Government.The
            objectives of the ERC were: (i) to support the
            Government's reform program, and more particularly the
            measures aimed at minimizing the negative social impact of
            the devaluation in the short tern; (ii) to provide necessary
            financial aid for the transition period, while follow-up
            operations were being prepared; and (iii) to continue the
            policy dialogue between the Governrment and IDA. Three
            lessons can be drawn from implementation of the ERC: First,
            Government's firm commitment to the reform program was
            a key element in the success of the operation. Second.
            budgetary support in a single-tranche disbursement was a
            satisfactory response to an emergency situation. Third, as
            far as poverty reduction is concerned, specific mechanisms
            for targeting vulnerable groups should be identified
            beforehand so that the impact on such groups can be maximized.
